item.title: Move From Sprockets to Webpacker On Small to Large Rails Apps
item.description: Rails 6 comes with Sprockets and Webpacker by default. Confusing, right? The default configuration is Webpacker for Javascript while Sprockets takes care of all the rest (CSS, images, fonts…). Let me tell you a secret: You don’t need both. Just use Webpacker. Legacy applications and older gems still use Sprockets to serve assets. This was done to add backwards compatibility. If you don’t have a good reason to keep Sprockets around, don’t.
